title: (28053) Madrid - 3 Calle del Monte Perdido
description: There are more like two parking lots during the day and at night it is good to leave the vehicle safe because it is quite colorful but not for sleeping, there are garbage cans the Ibis next door, Burger King, KFC, it is next to the Puente de Vallecas metro to sun in 4 or 5 stops. If you have a gym basic fit there is one and you can shower

title: (28922) Alcorcón - 11 Calle Estambul
description: Quiet, safe and free parking area at the door of Hopistal Quiron. It has a cafeteria for breakfast and the toilets are impeccable. Madrid X is a few meters away with a wide range of restaurants.

title: (28024) Madrid - 57 Calle Fuente del Tiro
description: Streets with free parking area to leave the van and take the Spanish Aviation metro, which takes you directly to the center of Madrid. We found it to be a quiet area to park all day, we had no problems

title: (28019) Madrid - 54 Calle Comandante Fontanes
description: Quite and free parking, no heigh limit, ground is sand and pretty flat. Next to a big park where its nice to have breakfast. Also very close to the metro. Neighborhood is really nice and friendly.

title: (28047) Madrid - 167 Calle Valmojado
description: Free parking in front of a park and near a crossroads.

title: (28922) Alcorcón - 0 Calle Bruselas
description: LIDL outdoor parking. Perfect to reach the center of Alcorcón (and possibly metro / bus) during the day, quiet and peaceful during the night. It is a commercial area with lots of parking lots nearby.

title: (28922) Alcorcón - 7-9 Avenida de América
description:
Long straight line with parking in both directions next to the side entrance of the Tres Aguas Shopping Center (the center parking has a gauge).

Ideal for visiting the shopping center (Mercadona plus all kinds of shops, restaurants, cinemas, etc., ...)

title: (28922) Alcorcón - 5 Calle Europa
description: Open parking lot from a Commercial center. Concrete almost flat surface.

title: (28038) Madrid - s/n Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala
title_short: (28038) Madrid - s/n Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala
description: Public fountain, garbage and public WC.

address.street: s/n Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala

title: (28031) Madrid - 19 Carretera Madrid a Rivas Jarama
title_short: (28031) Madrid - 19 Carretera Madrid a Rivas Jarama
description: It is a Repsol gas station. It closes early and has a good flow to refill water.

title: (28038) Madrid - 10 Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala
title_short: (28038) Madrid - 10 Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala
description:
In this street there are usually large parking spaces next to Parque de las Tetas (Cerro del Tio Pio), from where you have magnificent views of Madrid and the sunset. It has no shade and is not flat.
There is a free public toilet next door.
There are also several fountains, one of them in the children's area next to the viewpoint bar, although there are several more throughout the park. Next to it there are also some calisthenics bars to exercise.
It is in the Vallecas neighborhood, so relatively close you can find all kinds of establishments. It is about a 15-minute walk from the Nueva Numancia metro, which in 10 more minutes leaves you in the center of Madrid.

address.street: 10 Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala

title: (28047) Madrid - Av. de Angel Sanz Briz
title_short: (28047) Madrid - Av. de Angel Sanz Briz
description: Free parking next to the metro, from there 20 minutes by metro into the city.

title: (28032) Madrid - Autovía del Este
description: Cepsa gas station.

title: (28024) Madrid - 111 Calle de Escalona
description: Automatic laundry with extensive opening hours 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. and with a washing machine of up to 21 kg, and large dryers of 21 kg next to the N-5. no parking problems or payment area.

title: (28047) Madrid -
description: Free parking. Outside the regulated parking area. Next to the Green Wedge Park. Bus to the center 24h. 10 'walking from Madrid Río, 45' walking from Plaza Mayor and Casa de Campo (walking all through the park). Bike path to Madrid Río and Casa de Campo. Ideal to visit Madrid.

title: (45221) Esquivias - 94 Calle Emilia Pardo Bazán
description: A very quiet, wide and tree-lined parking lot, next to the municipal swimming pool, good place to spend the night or just relax.

title: (45221) Esquivias - 15A Calle Persiles y Segismunda
description: Large free ground

title: (28500) Madrid - 4X Diseminado Cr M 3020
description:
A well equipped and little crowded lagoon. Daytime only. Large AC fits well in the parking lot. Good place to spend the day or to rest. You pay €1 to enter and enjoy the picnic tables, the play area and bathroom. There is a restaurant/cafeteria (in it the toilets). Great place for a break near Madrid. Outside the enclosure there is a place to park and possibly spend the night (we did not stay).
Be careful when entering because you pass the Laguna sign (it is half covered with vegetation) and then when you go down the hill it seems that it is closed but there is a small door to the left of the gate.
In the parking lot there are more than 40 spaces and around 30 tables inside (not all of them have shade)

title: (28522) - 1A Lugar Parque Rivas
description: Discreet parking next to the FeuVert del Carrefour, it is not so busy, employees' cars usually park, the parking lights turn off at 23:23, bathrooms inside the carrefour. I have not been disturbed at any time. Well clean area. Wifi inside the carrefour.

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 3V Lugar Parque Rivas
description: Asphalt and dirt parking without prohibition sign no height bar, trees for shade. Next to Carrefour and other stores. No services. Restrooms in the mall.

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - Autovía del Este, 581
description: Small parking lot, easy access from the highway but almost no noise. Feels like you’re in nature but still very close to the city. Walking routes right by, so great if you have a dog. Didn’t stay overnight but didn’t see any signs prohibiting it.

title: (28012) Madrid - 2 Calle de Miguel Servet
description: Bathhouse which offers showers for a fee. 20 minutes of hot water and the shower space is big and clean, as it is cleaned after every use.  Currently open from 8:30-18:30 everyday, except Sunday only until 14:30.

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 10 Calle Thomas Edison
description: Decathlon parking very quiet. We were also parked during the day and everything was perfect.

title: (28922) Madrid - 36F Poligono S
description: Ample Ikea parking. Plenty of space, toilets at Ikea when it's open and you can also eat at Ikea. Quiet at night.

title: (28047) Madrid - 2 Calle de Pablo Sarasate
description: We have slept on this street without problems, and without noise one night. There are no motorhome prohibition signs, and we are a 40-minute walk from the center of Madrid.

title: (28011) Madrid - C. Maria del Carmen
description: Street parking area where we have left our car, and we have had no problems sleeping. The only drawback is that it is a bus stop area, because there is a stop right in front of it, but we even left our bikes in the bike rack for a full day and night, while we walked around Madrid, and they were not stolen. I want to think that it was not by chance, but because this falls within what should be normal

title: (28032) Madrid - Blvr. de Jose Prat
description: We discovered this place through a blog. It is free and you can stay overnight. Apparently there are always motorhomes parked here. We spent one night and everything was fine. Safe. It has a shopping center in front and the neighborhood is quiet with large parks.

title: (28007) Madrid - 47 Calle de Juan de Urbieta
title_short: (28007) Madrid - 47 Calle de Juan de Urbieta
description: Good place and very close to the Retiro Park, the center, the subway station, etc ... We have only been one night, there were people passing by and some cars with which the place was somewhat safer, to visit Christmas is great . ps: it is a blue zone but we do not pay when you come on weekends and holidays

title: (45200) Illescas - 20 Poligono los Pradillos
description: BP gas station. Displacement from 8 a.m. to adjoining factories. Quiet place, with the possibility of toilets at the gas station.

title: (28032) Madrid - 5 Avenida Comunidades
description: Quiet and secluded place, with a public toilet nearby.

title: (28011) Madrid -
description: Site. Very calm. Park and spend the night. Metro station adapted with elevator. Pretty good for wheelchairs

title: (45200) Toledo - 6 Avenida Recinto Ferial
description: Paquin in illescas behind the police and next to the sunny bullring

title: (28935) Móstoles -
description: Unpaved parking, next to a school, is a quiet neighborhood, I used to live in that area, there are usually no problems. I have spent 4 nights, nearby you have a gym (body factory) with a pool all year round, there you can pay for a day and use showers. There is a Dia supermarket, a 5-minute walk away, later a mercadona, and a carrefour, in the carrefour gasoline, where the wheels are built there is a little water hose. Except at parties, there is always room. You can see the sunset.

title: (28522) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 12 Calle José Luis Sampedro
description:
Very quiet area, next to the usual parking area for neighboring motorhomes. Glued to the local police with surveillance cameras in the area.
the water fountain works in summer
Litter bins.
A restaurant next door and a cafeteria/teteria.
Buses next door and metro 5 min with large parking.
Large motorhomes enter, it is usually free, if it is full in the vicinity there is always room.

title: (28012) Madrid - 54 Calle de Atocha
description: Pretty good looking laundy. Finding a parking place is almost impossible but a bit further it is managable. As of no nut sure about the opening hours since a sheet of paper blocked the times (8-22:00)

title: (28522) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 340 Calle de Junkal
description: Zone indicated to park day and night. Without services.

title: (28939) Arroyomolinos - 48 Calle Madrid
description: Flat parking next to the civil guard barracks, nearby there is a gym with spa (15 euros / day), bars, lidl, Mercadona, ...

title: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 3 Plaza de Blas de Otero
title_short: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 3 Plaza de Blas de Otero

title: (28939) Arroyomolinos - Unnamed Road
description: A quiet place, in the pine forest to spend the night

title: (28011) Madrid - 108 Paseo de Extremadura
description: Laundromat, with laundry and softener included. Machines with coins.

title: (28011) Madrid - Unnamed Road
description: Parking limited to the hours of the zoo. Looking a little, you will find places where the ac is perfectly parked. perfect for visiting the zoo.

title: (28939) Arroyomolinos - 31 Calle Madrid
description: A quiet place next to the sports center, overnight without any problem. Next door there is a civil guard barracks.

title: (28011) Madrid - 17 Calle Principal Dlas Provincias
description: Parking of an abandoned restaurant, there is no height limit or time zone. Very large sites

title: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 2T Calle Pamplona
description: Big parking lot all along the road right next to the metro station. Day and night allowed. We slept for one night without a problem and left our van in the day to go into Madrid. Parking spaces are about average length. We could fit our 6 meter van in a space. Might struggle if you’re longer.

title: (28005) Madrid - 26 Paseo Ciudad de Plasencia
description: Area in orange and blue lines. No height and length limit between two parks. Cars can park up to 12 hours and the maximum rate is six euros.

title: (45200) Illescas - 48P Calle Comuneros de Castilla
description: Large parking lot, quiet not far from the center. No service. Ideal for a stopover.

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 153 Avenida Campillo de San Isidro
title_short: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 153 Avenida Campillo de San Isidro
description: Signposted area for motorhomes. Quiet

title: (28011) Madrid - 7 Calle Ferial
description: Free parking day and night, lots of light, near Casa de Campo. Much less "nocturnal" activities. We arrived at 8pm and it's almost full. There are all kinds of vehicles, we have a motorhome and we found a good place.

title: (28011) Madrid - P.º de la Venta
description: Free off-road parking inside a park. 500 m from the metro. We arrived at 8pm and the parking space was almost free. No service.

title: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 691 Paseo de las Provincias
description:
Location reserved for vehicles other than cars, several other locations along this walk
200 meters from the Madrid Metro. ATTENTION: buy a combined ticket. shopping center at 500mts.

title_short: (28011) Madrid - Paseo Puerta del Angel S/N
description: Parking of the fairground of the Casa de Campo. It is frequented by motorhomes and vans, it is a quiet place to spend the night and close to the metro. The downtown is 15 minutes walking.

title: (28011) Madrid - 2 Ronda Toros
description: Large parking lot as a stopgap when "Casa do Campo" is crowded. 40 mins walk from Madrid.

title: (45200) Illescas - 6 Callejón San Pedro
description: A quiet place in a lovely town. downtown 2 min. We visited its historic center, the museum and sanctuary of charity, the collection of paintings by El Greco and his collection of relics. good places to eat

title: (28011) Madrid - 3 Carretera del Parque de Atracciones
title_short: (28011) Madrid - 3 Carretera del Parque de Atracciones
description: Park a little bit relish when the amusement park is open. It is located in the park Casa de Campo, a forest, although near the city center. There are many trees that form beautiful shadows and picnic tables. Workers in the park of attractions have no problems with campers. A fountain is located 5 minutes from the other side of the road (behind the attraction park), left of the small stream.

title_short: (45200) Illescas - 2 Calle Barriada de la Estacion. Estación Tren Illescas

title: (28011) Madrid - Carr. del Parque de Atracciones
title_short: (28011) Madrid - Carr. del Parque de Atracciones

description: Public parking without the possibility to stay overnight.

title: (28011) Madrid - 4 Ronda Lago

title: (45216) Carranque - Camino Egido
description: Motorhome area, it is assumed that there are two parking spaces, but they are still occupied by cars, you can certainly spend the night, we just drained.

title: (28030) Madrid - 66 Calle Jose Bergamín
description: It is a park that you can see that the works have been finished very recently and they are just putting up trees, we have spent 2 very quiet nights. some motorhomes staying overnight but the stalls are small so the motorhomes I have seen parked were occupying 3 stalls. It is a dirt car park with very little unevenness. good for fall - winter - spring, no big trees yet and no cover from the sun. being from land there is a lot of dust and having the windows open is a disaster

title: (28011) Madrid - Paseo de la Puerta del Ángel
title_short: (28011) Madrid - Paseo de la Puerta del Ángel
description: Top parking space. Safe and free. Directly on the lake only separated by restaurants. Very close to the center. Arrivals in the morning or at night after 11:00 p.m. Rather for smaller mobile homes.

address.street: Paseo de la Puerta del Ángel

title: (28011) Madrid - 14 Paseo Puerta del Ángel
description: Large free parking between park relaxation, picnic, attraction, zoo, swimming pool and small lake. Metro. No water, no service, but bar restaurants and girls of joys at night.

title: (28008) Madrid - 38 Cuesta de San Vicente
description: A car park with a perfect location in Madrid. Important to know, if you reserve online 2 hours earlier, it costs less.

description: Secure parking is near the police station

title: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 2V Ronda Gijón

title: (28008) Madrid - 1 Calle Profesor Martín Almagro Basch
title_short: (28008) Madrid - 1 Calle Profesor Martín Almagro Basch
description: Public parking at 2 steps from Plaza de España. Paid and frequented the day. Calm and less used at night.

title: (28011) Madrid - 3 Carretera Teleférico
description: Valuable place to visit Madrid. attached to the cycle path and in the middle of the park. Cable car that takes you downtown and restaurants and activities within walking distance. water fountain and dirt bins. at night the parking lot is completely illuminated and empty. recommended

title: (45200) Illescas - 2 Camino los Cerros
description: Quiet in the middle of nature very quiet. For 1 pleasant night with a beautiful sunset on the industrial polygon.

title: (28011) Madrid - Pl. de las Moreras
description: In Casa de Campo in Madrid, before one of the exits of the M30. It is a wide roundabout with spaces for about 30 vehicles. Very quiet and there is a fountain

title: (28939) Arroyomolinos - 7 Calle Puerto de Navacerrada
description: Repsol gas station, next to the Xanadú shopping center, friendly and attentive staff, the rest is somewhat noisy due to the location, right next to a McDonald's

title: (28008) Madrid - 2 Calle de Francisco y Jacinto Alcántara
title_short: (28008) Madrid - 2 Calle de Francisco y Jacinto Alcántara
description: Car parking on which it is possible to park motorhomes (even 7.5m like ours). you still have to be lucky to find a place. parking free from Saturday 3 p.m. parking near the heart of Madrid. 10min from Plaza de España or the Royal Palace. Municipal police building just under the parking lot, reassuring.

title_short: (28017) Madrid - Avenida de las Trece Rosas

title: (28008) Madrid - Paseo de Camoens
